description: Section enable/disable feature - Allow sections to be toggled on/off with dynamic keyboard mapping that only applies to enabled sections

userStories.title: Add enabled property to Marker type
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to store enabled state on markers so sections can inherit it.
acceptanceCriteria: Add optional `enabled?: boolean` property to Marker interface in src/types/marker.ts
Default value is true when not specified (backwards compatible)
Update addMarker in useMarkers hook to set enabled: true on new markers
Add updateMarkerEnabled action to MarkersActions interface
Implement updateMarkerEnabled in useMarkers hook
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Add enabled property to Section type
userStories.description: As a developer, I need sections to have an enabled property inherited from their start marker.
acceptanceCriteria: Add `enabled: boolean` property to Section interface in src/types/section.ts
Update getSections in src/utils/sections.ts to inherit enabled from startMarker
If startMarker.enabled is undefined, default to true
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Add enable/disable toggle button to SectionHeader
userStories.description: As a user, I want to toggle sections on/off with a button in the section header.
acceptanceCriteria: Add toggle button to SectionHeader component (next to export button)
Button shows clear enabled state (e.g., eye icon open/closed or power icon)
Add onToggleEnabled callback prop to SectionHeaderProps
Clicking toggle calls onToggleEnabled with section id
Button is clearly part of the section control group (name, download, toggle)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Visual styling for disabled sections
userStories.description: As a user, I want disabled sections to be visually distinct from enabled sections.
acceptanceCriteria: Disabled sections appear muted (reduced opacity or grayed out)
Section header controls (name, export, toggle) appear dimmed when disabled
Export button is hidden or disabled for disabled sections
Clear visual distinction without being visually noisy
Waveform area for disabled section rendered with reduced opacity or muted colors
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Update keyboard mapping to enabled sections only
userStories.description: As a user, I want keyboard shortcuts 1-9 to only trigger enabled sections.
acceptanceCriteria: Filter sections to only enabled ones before applying keyboard mapping
Key 1 plays first enabled section, key 2 plays second enabled section, etc.
Disabling a section removes it from keyboard mapping and shifts subsequent keys
Re-enabling a section reinserts it based on waveform position
Maximum 9 enabled sections can have keyboard shortcuts
Update useKeyboardControls hook to work with enabled sections
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Display keyboard index on enabled sections
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see which keyboard number triggers each enabled section.
acceptanceCriteria: Enabled sections display their assigned keyboard number (1-9) near section name
Disabled sections do not display a keyboard number
Numbers update immediately when sections are toggled
Number badge styled consistently with section header controls
Typecheck passes
